recommendations:
Ben Van Aken



I've had the pleasure to work with Kevin on one of my projects where he served as an Agile coach for our delivery team.
His knowledge and application of agile are on point which was a great addition to our team. He is a great person, and I wouldn't hesitate to work with him again.

Beerend Lauwers



So your company has decided to go all-in on agile! Or perhaps you've applied it to a particular project, and others are taking note of your success - they're interested in rolling it out across the shop. But you could use some help in getting it all off the ground.

Kevin is your guy.

He has worked in enterprises big and small, where he helped roll out the agile way of working to great acclaim. Personally, I worked with him on a project where he was brought on as a highly experienced Drupal developer, but he was absolutely invaluable in helping me learn more about how to approach a multitude of problems in an agile manner. 

If you're like me, with some agile projects under my belt, Kevin is an infinite source of experience and wisdom to learn from. He always clarifies agile concepts with an anecdote or story, ensuring that you get more than the gist of it - you can actually use it right off the bat. He is happy to act as a sounding board to refine and discuss agile concepts with you and provides constructive feedback along the way. 

In short, Kevin is a catalyst for accelerating the growth of budding Scrum masters, agile coaches and anyone else interested in the agile way of working and thinking.

If you're completely new to agile, Kevin is a prime candidate for starting off on the right foot. He understands it from top to bottom: from the way developers can be empowered to take agency of, responsibility for, and pride in their work, to how managers can learn to foster an agile-friendly working environment and reap the productive benefits, to communicating and collaborating with clients regularly and transparently, fostering trust and confidence in the product or service you are providing.

You want that agile quality? You want that agile velocity? 

Kevin is your guy.

occupation: Drupal Developer at E-Sepia Web Innovation
headline: Drupal Web Developer at E-Sepia Web Innovation
summary:
Hello World!

I am Giannis, currently residing in Athens,Greece. Always growing, focusing on being the best in my job, and prioritizing clients’ needs and satisfaction, regardless of the project.

My studies and my job experience have helped me progress into the world of web development as well as towards being the best version of myself.

My specialties include quickly learning new skills and programming languages, problem solving, working under pressure on tight schedules to deliver my best, as well as adapting to new or existing projects, through Agile workflows, in no time.

So far I have professional experience in Javascript, HTML, CSS(SASS,Tailwind),Object Oriented PHP,Vue.js, mySql, Git/Github as well as popular CMSs like Drupal and Wordpress. Specifically on Drupal, I have obtained skills both in custom theming, as well as custom module development. I have also minimal experience with Mongo DB and the Laravel framework.


I am still enthusiastically grabbing onto any other programming languages, frameworks or principles I can integrate into my head's coding web.

experiences.title: Web Developer
experiences.description:
Joining Netstudio through Codearena 2018, I quickly rose to be a part of its Development team, working both on its e-commerce platform and on specific projects, mainly built with Drupal.

Depending on the project needs, my responsibilities included:

• Architecting and coding custom modules to meet each project's unique specifications.
• Migrating and integrating website data.
• Converting designs to working front-end code, in a pixel-perfect fashion.
• Optimizing page speed and usability to deliver the best experience to users.
• Drupal site building.
• Drupal custom theming.

occupation: Project Manager at Hostdog Web Hosting Services
headline: Project Manager

accomplishment_publications.name: A parametric landscape design approach for urban green infrastructure development
accomplishment_publications.publisher: International Conference on Changing Cities II: Spatial, Design, Landscape & Socio-economic dimensions
accomplishment_publications.description: Landscape design depends on many parameters and numerous relations that increase the complexity of the process, even more in urban areas. The Generative Landscape Design System (GLDS) takes advantage of mathematical models of physical processes, algorithms, and statistical analysis, in order to increase the environmental and ecological performance of the design solution. It consists of four distinct subsystems with linear correlation, each of which is governed by one or more mathematical mechanisms that allow the application of self-organizing strategies. The first subsystem generates the terrain, the second is responsible for organizing the space, the third creates the shading structure and the fourth defines the planting zones. The GLDS is a dynamic tool that could adapt to the specific requirements of any open free space as long as the necessary initial input data are provided (i.e. weather file, orientation, sunlight obstacles, plot boundaries).

accomplishment_projects.title: Emporiou square (Distinguished with honors)
accomplishment_projects.description:
This project concerns participation in the Small Scale Architectural Competition entitled "Recovery - highlighting enlargement area of the roads D. Solomou - M. Alexandrou and the Municipal site 210" and received an Honorable Mention.
Emporiou square and its surrounding area (and the area in its immediate vicinity) are a typical example of public urban space in the contemporary Greek cities. It was formed over the last decades through a continuous collation of unresolved problems and potentials, more or less latent.
The present state of the study area is indicative of the need for a contemporary, integrated design approach that will eliminate the current pathogenetic factors while highlighting its hidden dynamics, by restoring its integrity as a public space that can be essentially assimilated in everyday life  by the citizens of Serres. The proposal aims to newly transform the Emporiou square into what it really represents, through a dual convention; the reconstruction of the public space and the decrystallization of an easily legible urban identity.

accomplishment_projects.title: Urban nature cores (Distinguished with honors)
accomplishment_projects.description:
This project concerns participation in the architectural competition entitled "Kozani x4" and was distinguished with honors (acquisition).
In a search for a solution that rises to the specific demands of Kozani, the proposed approach seeks to redesign a group of typical city blocks into one new building block group that highlights the fundamental structural components of the urban fabric - the dynamic development of the city around one historic central core and the adaptation to the terrain.  
The proposal is based on the activation of potential urban spaces - open spaces, unconstructed plots - of each new building block group. These urban cores, act as joints in the proposed pedestrian path network for the old city.

Now you have somebody you can rely on !!!
